channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report X-2023120991
item.description:
Report X-2023120991

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Qa was call over to unload due to a leaking hazmat. DescribePack: The tops was loose causing hazmat to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Qa clean up the spill place hazmat inside a red tote to be taking over to the hazmat area to be process.

item.title: Report E-2023120374
item.description:
Report E-2023120374

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NAT experienced a UN1760 Astro Clean ACP-10 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents and pH down were then deployed to neutralize and clean the release. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023080076
item.description:
Report I-2023080076

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-31T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: SOPERTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Tractor trailer left the roadway resulting in a rollover. Hazmat One was called to dispatch a team to contain and clean the area. IBC container was crushed and leaking. Material was lost due to damage from roll over.
